moves.1. c4 Nf6 2. Nf3 c5 3. g3 Nc6 4. Bg2 d6: Laboriously arriving at the 4 Knights variation of the English.
moves.5... Bf5 6. d3 e6: Black prepares a break in the center, at d5.
moves.7. O-O: In true hypermodern spirit White invites him to do just that, challenging, "Show me what you've got!"
moves.7... Be7 8. h3 h6 9. Bd2 O-O 10. Ne1 a6: Both sides mix it up on the K-side, pawn-breaks abound.
moves.16. fxe5 dxe5 17. Nxd4 exd4 18. Qb3: The first real threat of the game: White threatens to push o d6, with a discovered check, winning Black's dark-squared Bishop.
moves.18... Qd6 19. Bf4 c4 20. Qxc4: ?? Ignoring the showstopper 20. Bd6 cb3  21. Be7. This is why I'm not a GM and Anand is.  ;-)
moves.20... Qc5 21. e5: Then again, who can resist pawns that look like this?
moves.21... Rac8 22. Qxc5 Rxc5 23. Rac1 Rfc8 2: Black is absolutely out of useful moves now. Still, he struggles on.
